stories.title: Apple and Android phones hacked by Italian spyware, Google says
Bronze Age people much preferred making weapons using iron from meteors

stories.text:
This is what I don't get: if there is a way for another user – a family member or a team administrator – to reset the password of your E2E account, doesn't it mean, that the employees of 1Password[1], Bitwarden[2], and Tresorit[3] could do the same?

Then what is the entire purpose of such services, if their providers still need to be blindly trusted?

I believe that this is a required feature by most enterprise customer. Maybe that's why B2C-focused Standard Notes doesn't provide any way to recover your account if the password is lost[4].

[1] https://support.1password.com/recovery/

[2] https://bitwarden.com/help/admin-reset/

[3] https://support.tresorit.com/hc/en-us/articles/216114497-I-forgot-my-password

[4] https://standardnotes.com/help/6/i-ve-forgotten-my-password-what-should-i-do
